entry.value: This kit demonstrates how to create a AAA quality, high-performance optimized game/first-person shooter (FPS) UI using the Scaleform GFx Direct Access API with ActionScript 2 content.
This kit demonstrates how to create a AAA quality, high-performance optimized game/first-person shooter (FPS) UI using the Scaleform GFx Direct Access API with ActionScript 3 content.

This kit demonstrates a fully-featured, AAA user interface solution for PC and console games. It shows splash to in-game content flow, screen resource management, background data loading, video streaming and PC/console input handling with ActionScript 2 content.

This kit demonstrates a fully-featured, AAA user interface solution for PC and console games. It shows splash to in-game content flow, screen resource management, background data loading, video streaming and PC/console input handling with ActionScript 3 content.

The Scaleform MMO Kit, designed for optimum performance and memory savings, provides a foundation for massively multiplayer online game UI. The kit includes CLIK-based interface elements as well as frameworks for drag and drop, icon resource management, and data binding.

The Mobile Game Kit provides a best-practices sample implementation of a mobile, touch-based game built using Autodesk® Scaleform® as the engine and renderer. The game, Starforce Battlement, is written entirely in ActionScript 3 and leverages the new 'Shippable Mobile FxPlayer’.

This sample demonstrates ActionScript 3 BitmapData usage to slice Bitmaps and MovieClips into sub-components, in order to create new and interesting animation effects that are not easily possible with conventional methods.

The Scaleform v4.2.22 SDK is the latest version of our leading UI solution which includes an all new, highly optimized, multi-threaded renderer, as well as support for ActionScript 3.0. Please note that Scaleform AMP and Scaleform Exporter now require a license key, even for fully licensed customers. Click here to download your license file. Scaleform 4.2 includes many exciting new features and resources for Scaleform developers:

Scaleform 4.2 includes a new mobile-ready player with flexible input support and tutorials that make Scaleform the ideal solution for developing mobile game UI as well as full 2D games and applications.
Scaleform 4.2 provides additional ActionScript support, including CacheAsBitmap and NetSocket functionality.
Scaleform 4.2 introduces generational garbage collection, which uses object life times to provide much faster GC cycles.
Scaleform 4.2 is available on all the latest hardware, from mobile devices to game consoles. If you don’t see what you need, please contact the sales team.
Please help us improve the SDK by reporting bugs in our ticketing system and posting comments and suggestions to the Scaleform 4.2 developers forum.

See how the combination of Flash tweening and simple, yet powerful ActionScript extensions can be used to animate the 3D positioning of your UI. Hold down the left mouse button while moving the mouse to rotate in 3D.
See how the combination of Flash tweening and native 3D ActionScript support can be used to animate the positioning of your UI in three dimensions.

In this demo, four Flash Filter effects (Blur, Glow, Drop Shadow and Adjust Color) are shown individually applied to a simple Flash Object. All four effects are also combined and applied to a single Flash Object.
Here we demonstrate a standard sound event protocol for playing sounds from Flash with simple commands using AS2 content.
Here we demonstrate a standard sound event protocol for playing sounds from Flash with simple commands using AS3 content.

In this demo we demonstrate selective rendering of Flash to specific textures inside of a 3D model. Flash is simultaneously being rendered underneath, on and above a 3D model. This demo also illustrates dynamic loading of movies.
Here we demonstrate how a form can be placed upon a 3D surface. Note that the forms can be fully interactive, regardless of the manner in which the 3D object is being manipulated.
This demo shows true 3D being rendered inside a movable Flash window. It illustrates Flash effects, such as Tweens, on a render target for 3D.

This example demonstrates three videos (some with Alpha) which are streaming into seperate video players within a single Flash file. These players can be moved, resized, rotated and interacted with, while the videos are playing with AS2 content.
This example demonstrates video playback from an AS3 Flash file. The Flash movie provides simple controls for volume, pausing and restarting the video.

This demo shows our IME implementation for Asian character sets. The candidate list has been prepopulated to make suggestions for specific word choices; note the intelligent candidate list positioning. Custom skinning is also an option for IME.
This demo demonstrates how to use ImageDelegate class for image substitution.
This module is not currently installed. To visit the Scaleform Video product page and learn more about it click here.
This module is not currently installed. To visit the Scaleform Video product page and learn more about it click here.
This demo pack is currently not installed. Click here to visit our demos page and learn more or download it directly from the link below.
This sample demonstrates how internationalization can be achieved with Scaleform using GFx::FontMap, GFx::FontLib and GFx::Translator classes.
Here we demonstrate the fonts utilizing the draw text API.
Here we demonstrate the fonts utilizing the draw text API with ActionScript 3 content.
This player includes our Analyzer for Memory and Performance (AMP™), which shows real-time statistics about how much memory is being used by various components in your interactive content.
The Scaleform 4.2 Player supports playing native SWF files from Flash or Scaleform's proprietary GFX file format. This is the DirectX 10 version of the Scaleform player.
The Scaleform 4.2 Player supports playing native SWF files from Flash or Scaleform's proprietary GFX file format. This is the DirectX 11 version of the Scaleform player.
The Scaleform 4.2 Player supports playing native SWF files from Flash or Scaleform's proprietary GFX file format. This is the DirectX 9 version of the Scaleform player.
The Scaleform 4.2 Player supports playing native SWF files from Flash or Scaleform's proprietary GFX file format. This is the OpenGL version of the Scaleform player.

The ‘Tiny Player’ is a very simple example which demonstrates a minimal integration of Scaleform, on most platforms. It is self-contained in one cpp file and provides a great way to quickly learn about and try out the SDK. This is the DirectX 10 version of the Tiny player.

The ‘Tiny Player’ is a very simple example which demonstrates a minimal integration of Scaleform, on most platforms. It is self-contained in one cpp file and provides a great way to quickly learn about and try out the SDK. This is the DirectX 11 version of the Tiny player.

The ‘Tiny Player’ is a very simple example which demonstrates a minimal integration of Scaleform, on most platforms. It is self-contained in one cpp file and provides a great way to quickly learn about and try out the SDK. This is the DirectX 9 version of the Tiny player.

The ‘Tiny Player’ is a very simple example which demonstrates a minimal integration of Scaleform, on most platforms. It is self-contained in one cpp file and provides a great way to quickly learn about and try out the SDK. This is the OpenGL version of the Tiny player.
The Scaleform 4.2 Player supports playing native SWF files from Flash or Scaleform's proprietary GFX file format. This is the OpenGL2 version of the Scaleform player.

Converts SWF files to Scaleform’s proprietary GFx format for texture memory reduction, and can write out texture files into DDS files as well. It is custom configurable through the use of command-line options. Click Below for License File.

Scaleform AMP uses frame-based history graphs to quickly spot issues with Flash content. Scaleform AMP also includes a complete ActionScript profiler with hierarchical function and per-line timings, showing which scripts need optimization. Click Below for License File.
This sample shows a complex and heavily animated 3D inventory menu developed using ActionScript 3.0 and the CLIK components. Hold down the left mouse button while moving the mouse to rotate in 3D.
This sample shows a complex and heavily animated 3D inventory menu developed using ActionScript 2.0 and the CLIK components. Hold down the left mouse button while moving the mouse to rotate in 3D.

This sample MMO UI concept highlights our new renderer's much improved GPU + CPU perf, particularly when displaying large amounts of complex Flash content. Draw Primitive batching, now done aggressively by the Scaleform renderer, can be viewed using GFxPlayer batch-view mode (CTRL-J).
Here we demonstrate how a form can be placed upon a 3D surface. Note that the forms can be fully interactive, regardless of the manner in which the 3D object is being manipulated.

The core technology behind Scaleform translates vector graphics into triangles that can be rendered by GPUs. This sample shows a complex vector shape, and its tessellation output can be viewed via the GFxPlayer wireframe display mode (CTRL-W).
This sample shows a vector based timeline animation. Its tessellation output can be viewed via the GFxPlayer wireframe display mode (CTRL-W).
This sample shows a bitmap based timeline animation. Its tessellation output can be viewed via the GFxPlayer wireframe display mode (CTRL-W).
Masks can be used to create special effects by cutting out content dynamically at runtime. This sample shows an animating mask overtop an image.
This C++ sample demonstrates how to leverage the Scaleform Draw Text API to draw text using multiple font typefaces and sizes.
Sample character manager UI built using the Flash CS4 components. The sample uses List, ScrollBar, TextInput, Label, RadioButton, ProgressBar, NumericStepper, ComboBox, CheckBox and TextArea.
Sample property control UI built using the Flash CS4 components. The sample uses Label, Slider, ColorPicker and Button.

See how the combination of Flash tweening and simple, yet powerful ActionScript extensions can be used to animate the 3D positioning of your UI. Hold down the right mouse button while moving the mouse to rotate in 3D.
This demo pack is currently not installed. Click here to visit our demos page and learn more or download it directly from the link below.
This demo pack is currently not installed. Click here to visit our demos page and learn more or download it directly from the link below.
This demo pack is currently not installed. Click here to visit our demos page and learn more or download it directly from the link below.
This demo pack is currently not installed. Click here to visit our demos page and learn more or download it directly from the link below.

The CLIK AS3 Browser demonstrates the power and flexibility of the CLIK AS3 component set with detailed samples and tutorials for developing UIs using the latest incarnation of the Scaleform component set.
This document explains how to get up and running quickly with Scaleform 4.2.
This document introduces basic Scaleform usage and 3D engine integration through a DirectX 9 example.
This document explains how to get up and running quickly with Scaleform Common Lightweight Interface Kit.
This document explains how to get up and running quickly with Scaleform Common Lightweight Interface Kit's button component.
This document explains how the Scaleform Common Lightweight Interface Kit GameDelegate is used to communicate between Adobe Flash and C++.
This module is not currently installed. To visit the Scaleform Video product page and learn more about it click here.
This module is not currently installed. To visit the IME product page and learn more about it click here.
This module is not currently installed. To visit the Scaleform AMP product page and learn more about it click here.
This document describes multi-threaded rendering configuration in Scaleform 4.2.
Documentation supporting the entire Scaleform 4.2 library, including everything from general framework and module overviews to detailed class and function information.
This document is a guide to upgrading from earlier versions of Scaleform (Scaleform 2.2 onwards) to the latest versions.
This document describes best practices for efficiently implementing and effectively leveraging Scaleform 4.2 in your game.
This document contains detailed implementation instructions for the Scaleform CLIK framework and the prebuilt components provided with it using Actionscript 2 content.
This document contains detailed implementation instructions for the Scaleform CLIK framework and the prebuilt components provided with it using Actionscript 3 content.
This document describes the font and text rendering system used in Scaleform 4.2, providing details on how to configure both the art assets and Scaleform C++ APIs for internationalization.
This document explains how to use the 3D features of Scaleform 4.2 and higher.
This document describes the details of using Scale9Grid functionality in Scaleform to create resizable windows, panels and buttons.
This document describes ActionScript extensions available in Scaleform 4.2.
This document describes configuring XML support available in Scaleform 4.2.
This document describes the GFxDrawText API available in Scaleform 4.2. This API can be used for C++ driven text rendering and formatting outside of the GFxMovieView and ActionScript sandbox.
This document explains how to configure, optimize, and manage memory in Scaleform.
This document describes the GFxExport utility tool which preprocesses SWF files into an optimized GFx format for use with Scaleform.
This document details the Scaleform LITE configuration libraries and describes how to customize Scaleform LITE in your own application.
This document describes the communication between C++, Flash and ActionScript using Scaleform 4.2 and later.
This document describes how to use the Scaleform AMP tool
This document describes the architecture and content of the Scaleform 4.2 MMO Kit, a fully-featured, AAA, reusable user interface solution for a PC MMORPG.
This document contains the working set of Actionscript functions and options that are supported by Scaleform.
This document outlines the audio support included with Scaleform 4.2 and higher versions.
This document describes the Scaleform Exporter tool and how to use it to generate and preview export assets from Flash content.
From how to install the Scaleform Launcher, to a 3-part overview of Scaleform’s new HUD kit, these extensive developer tutorials explain various parts of Scaleform.
A walk-through on how to rapidly prototype a basic front end menu system using CLIK components.
Learn how to integrate Flash files into the Gamebryo Lightspeed engine.

Useful for both beginners and seasoned Scaleformers, this video walks you through the initial installation of the Scaleform SDK, focusing on the SDK Browser, Scaleform player and the Developer Center.
Step by step instructions on how to use Flash and Scaleform with the Unreal Development Kit.
